The theme restaurants were decent although the service was a little slow (Italien)

THe Mountain (9 Holes) has some great view and holes but also a couple of quirky ones. The other 9's Lakes and Ocean are a little more forgiving. Not cheap though as a round and rentals cost $200 US

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two days before a cruise in Nov. We paid a little extra for the Royal Service and were happy we did. The breakfast and the happy hour reception at night (drinks and snacks) were worth it. There was also a private pool. Our room was in a great location and was beautiful and spotless. Our room safe did not work at first but was fixed immediately when we brought it to their attention.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort grounds are beautiful but it is a little spread out. We didn't mind walking and enjoyed being serenaded by the coquis at night. The pools are beautiful. There really is no beach to speak of. The property was a little hard to find as they are doing construction in the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and the service was very good. We rented a car and drove to the El Yunque rain forest which is very close by. Parking was $15 per day or $20 for valet at the hotel.
reviews.title: Not-So-Gran Melia (Thumbs down for Trump)
Potentially A Great Resort, but not yet
reviews.text: We only ate at one restaurant - the Italian one. The food was delicious but the portions were TINY. It was a little overpriced for the amount of food you received. That is our only complaint about the property. Otherwise it was a perfect stay in paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choose and paid an extra $1300 for breakfast and dinner. Two daily non-alcoholic drinks were part of that meal plan. Breakfast according to the internet write-up was buffet style. Dinner was also buffet but had two other a la carte restaurants available. Because the resort had virtually a handful of guests, there was no buffets. This meant guests had to eat at the other a la carte restaurants... and they only had one of these open evey other night. In addition, tipping was thus required (where it would not have been with buffets). There was no entertainment. This resort was out of the taxi zone... which was not specified upfront in the online hotel description. Service was not good in general. The beach was not walkable nor the ocean swimable (strong under currents), The main building however is very beautiful.
reviews.title: Amazing Time - Shocked at the Horrible Reviews
Loved Paridise
reviews.text: The hotel was amazing i just had a problem with dinner reservations and some people were very rude! But, overall it was a place i will never forget.

reviews.title: Fine experience overall but you're naive if you're expecting the Four Seasons or Peninsula stay.
reviews.text: My wife and I returned from a five-night stay at this lovely all-inclusive resort in January, and, like any new property (opened 3/04), it has kinks that have to be ironed out. I preface this posting by saying that my wife and I both work in the hotel/ hospitality industry for large hotel companies, and i must say that the Paradisus passes the test. The positives severly outweigh the negatives, and by reading many of these December postings, I have to believe that the Paradisus took the criticism to heart and "fixed" most of these bugs.

reviews.title: Beautiful facility!
reviews.text: This is an all-inclusive resort where tips/ charges are taken care of by your daily rate. But I must say, the staff treated us like royalty from the moment we stepped out of our taxi. The door/bell staff are very cheerful and make an effort to please. They socialize with you and offer assistance before you even have to ask. In the hospiatlity industry, we are expected to anticipate our guest's needs, and at the Paradisus, they do that. From the bellmen down to the maids, they make a sincere effort to make you happy. I happen to believe that, despite it being all-inclusive, it's Ok to tip a couple of bucks. There were times I didn't have change and did not leave a tip, and it was fine with their staff. They didn't seeme bothered or slowed their service because of this. Believe me, this happens at many resorts (Cancun and Domomican rep. come to mind). I received terrific service on my first day through to the fifth day. My wife was there for a conference and I just tagged along and had fun.

reviews.title: Great vacation!
reviews.text: The lobby bars are very good. You get top of the line liquor and you get your drink refreshed before you're even finished with the one y0ou have in your hand. There was a waiter, which I cannot remember his name, who must have swerved around 50 people in this one area. He was efficient and very friendly. I watched as he filled everyone's order (correctly) and quickly. No one tipped him. Not one. But he came back and gave the 100% service time and time again. I live in Chicago and let me tell you, I can go 15 minutes without having my drink refreshed or even have trouble getting the waiters attention. But at Paradisus, you almost never have to wave a waiter/ waitress over to you because they're already there.

reviews.title: All Inclusive gets good review
reviews.text: I disagree with the assertion that the pool bar/ waitresses sucked. The days varied as far as occupancy ( ranged from 40-75%), but I received great service in the pool. I had a waitress ask me at least every 15-20 minutes if i wanted something. Yes, she did her rounds. Best of all, when i was just snoozing, she didn't bother me like some resorts do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at this resort. If you want a complete vacation to visit the island, rent a car.
reviews.title: Great...rent a car for a complete vacation!

reviews.text: Many,many complaints were necessary to finally have it removed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at the Paradisus. It's absolutely beautiful and the staff is for the most part pretty friendly. As many others have stated, this place falls short in many ways and we were quite disappointed. We got there and were told that they were only at a 23% occupancy. We thought great, we will have no problems eating where we want. We are then told that you have to book reservations for you dinners way ahead. We tried to get in somewhere the first night we got there and were told there were no openings! With 23% occupancy, how can the restaurants be full? We were on a company trip so I mentioned this to our Marketing director who proceeded to check on the reservations himself and they gave him 10 spots at 3 different restaurants?? How does that work? The food was pretty good tasting however; it was ALWAYS cold at the buffets and not just a little cold. You would expect better quality of food at such a nice all-inclusive. We were wondering if there is ever any sort of Health Dept. that inspects and checks the foods temps. Also, for an all-inclusive they don't make foods very readily available. There is a very limited room service menu. There is no grill or anything right at the pool. You have to go into one of the restuarants to eat. Also, none of the staff is eager to get you another drink, many times we had to just go to the bar and get our own. This is definetly a beautiful place but for the money you could go to an all-inclusive in Mexico and get much better service and food. We will not go back here.
reviews.title: Lovely place but bring some power bars with you for dinner...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to Puerto Rico several times before, we were able to avoid some of the potential hassles and overall had a really nice time. Hopefully, some of these tips can help you. The hotels in PR tend to be pricy - Paradisus included. However, Paradisus serves decent food in the buffets, very good food in the reservations required places and has top shelf drinks included - the value is not bad as compared to other places. Paradisus has nice, large rooms with balconies. The beach is OK, not great. But the pools are wonderful and the place is large - i.e. not crowded. The service staff is primarily younger folks (this is not their career unlike what you find in many other Carribean destinations) - you see many of the things that can come with that - service is not always rapid fire or accurate - but it is generally very good. The hotel is well outside of San Juan. If you want to do excursions with a tour company, you get stuck with the inevitable waits you see anywhere in the world. (I abhor waits and shuttles) Here's some advice - if you are going to leave the resort and tour or partake in excursions, rent a car. Driving in PR is easy, rental cars are cheap, picking them up at the airport is fast and easy, self park is close to the rooms. A lot of cool stuff can be done on your own, you don't need a tour company. Or, hook up with the tour company at the destination rather than waiting on a shuttle. There are a lot of people from the North East. They, generally, have a more brusque approach to things - if that really bothers you, don't go to PR because it is a big destination for New Yorkers.
reviews.title: Pretty Darned Good

likes.disliked: — distance from room to pool etc.

reviews.title: A week in paradise
reviews.text: I felt I needed to add a review to this website after using it in preparation for our family's trip. I read through many reviews ranging from "this place is hell on earth", to "greatest destination I have ever been." After the reviews I did not know what to expect, but I trusted my family's decision and could not wait to get away. Our party included 18 people ranging in age from my grandparents to young cousins. I am a 29 year old male. I should note here that our last family trip to an all-inclusive resort was a disaster. Stay away from Playa Naco in the Dominican Republic at all costs. Paradisus was head and shoulders above our last experience. The trip to and from the airport was about 40 minutes by van and not bad at all. Our first order of business was an upgrade to royal service. I recommend this move if your budget allows. It provided access to a few extra ammenities including a separate royal service pool (ask for the mojitos), and some upgrades in rooms and dining. The all inclusive food and drink worked out very well for our party. It was great to be able to eat or get a drink at any time, day or night. My uncle was able to force me into a shot of tequila and a beer as I stepped out of breakfast one morning. The quality of the food was very good over all. This included the breakfast (good omelettes) and lunch buffets, and all of the different restaurants on sight. The only negatives here were the slow service at one or two of the restaurants, and some confusion over reservations. Not bad over all. Room service (try the quesadilla) and butlers were also free with royal service. The main pool in the center of the resort was a lot of fun for all including water basketball and other sports. I should note here, if you are a looking for a beach-front resort, paradisus is not for you. The pools were great and there was a beach volleyball court. The sand and beach area were not great. The staff and service was very competent and friendly over all, including one woman with beautiful eyes that my brother is still talking about. Some slow service in the restaurants but we had a party of 18 to serve each night. We were lucky enough to have great weather for most of the week. A little overcast and rain at times. The resort did get buggy at night and my feet and ankles were pretty bitten up all week. On our last night we were fortunate enough to catch the "white party." A dance party where guests and staff (yes she was there) showed up wearing white and we danced and drank until the wee hours of the morning. A great way to end the week. My family's review was very positive over all. We all had a great time and I would recommend the resort. My major complaints were the lack of a great beach area and the bugs. I think I covered the important points and I hope you find the review helpful. Bring your sunblock and bug spray and enjoy the trip. Have a mojito for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: After reading the reviews in Trip Advisor I was prepared for the worst. After booking this package online I was unaware that you had to prepay a shuttle fee, please make sure you pay the fee otherwise it could be a very expensive cab ride to the resort. The resort is beautiful in appearance however it is 45 mins east of the airport and remote. The staff was polite and professional but weren't trained in providing excellent customer service. I didn't have a problem booking the restaurants for dinner. The best one I went to was Toscano in terms of atmosphere. One of the waitresses told me that in May the restaurants would no longer be part of the all inclusive package and that you would have to pay for the meals separately. I had breakfast at Caribeno twice the first outside which was not so good with all the black birds swarming around and the second time inside. I had to ask the hostess to get someone to replace my cream because there was a gnat in it. The waiters were nice though as was the staff who drive the trolleys around the gtounds. Also the resort does porvide day trips but you have to pay for each trip separately, one at least should be included in the package. I would suggest to the all the people who had not so pleasant experiences write Sol Melia Resorts the company that manages the Paradisus to express their displeasures.
reviews.title: Extremely Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple

Thanks to the advice of some savvy travelers, the suggestion of upgrading to "royal service" was heeded. I firmly believe if you can afford it, upgrade. The service was notably better as far as gaining dinner reservations easily with other advantages such as a private butler. Our
reviews.title: Paradisus tries but it's not a 5 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is very beautiful, but the service was the worst I have ever experienced. It took 1 1/2 hours to check in! Even after this length of time, one of the couples went to their room only to find it preoccupied. Had to go back to the office for another hour to get it straightened out. Next morning check-out took 1 hour. The desk said that we had only paid for two rooms and owed for a third room. We had booked online, but they said they had no record of an online booking. With duplicate paperwork (which they took at check-in) we were able to prove we had paid for 3 rooms. They said they would not charge us for the 3rd room, but When I arrived home from our vacation, they had charged my credit card I had used for incidentals over $700 in unlawful charges. These charges on my credit card were placed without authorization or my signature. I contacted them, and it literally took 3 full days to get it straightened out. Wells Fargo said that these charges were all done illegally because they did not contain a reference number. The hotels explanation was: "Someone by a name similar to yours came and checked in a week later, and we accidently charged the wrong credit card. The funny thing is...they didn't have my credit card at all when supposedly this other couple checked in. I had to cancel my credit card because I was afraid they would keep charging it. "What a scary Situation". We will NEVER stay there again! We feel they are disgusting and dishonest in everyway.
reviews.title: Dishonest, Terrible Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just beautiful. The lobby area is huge, with plenty of places to sit and relax. It has several water fountains and ponds that give you the sensation of being in a truly tropical place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Grand Melia Puerto Rico is not a traditional hotel .The rooms are villages grouped in units of 4 to 6 each (three on the bottom and three on the second floor) There are not elevators and you cannot park in front of your village, instead you must park near the lobby or the casino and they will take you to your room in a golf card. If you don’t want to walk you must wait for the golf car to pick you up and take you back to the car. They pass by frequently or you can call the front desk and ask them to send someone to pick you up.
reviews.title: Held Hostage at the Gran Melia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: Though the resort itself is beautiful, we found that it really never exceeded our expectations. The lobby area, pool, furnishings, spa, etc. are gorgeous. The rooms are a decent size. The food is nothing special, which is to be expected in an all-inclusive I guess. For the money, we would recommend staying at The Ritz and be assured of exceptional service. With few exceptoins, we found most staff to be apathetic. Three out of the five days we were there, our room had not been cleaned by the time we returned from the pool around 4pm. This was at a time when the resort was more than half empty so I wouldn't want to be there when it is at capacity.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel, Service Needs Improvement

reviews.text: just returned 3/20/05 from hotel and their are several area to be concerned with:First-Transportation,when you cal there they either give you the conciege or transportation to arrange travel from the airport.These are two different services within the hotel ,so be aware when you call to confirm and they say there is no reservation.Also the hotel does not tell you that a cab (all vans) from the airport is less expensive and not a per person charge as is the hotel.

reviews.title: A fantastic trip to paradise
reviews.text: Reservations for eating were impossible.They have 3 restaurants that require reservations and they do not let you make them on the phone.The restaurants are small and it's hard to get a reservation at a reasonable time.They do not open reservations for Fri or Sat until certain times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at the Paradisus. The service was horrific. We seemed to be bothering everyone when we asked something. It took us three hours to get from the lobby to our room. They insisted we use their bell boy and this is how long it took to get a party of 8 to our two bungalows. The food was no better than a cafeteria. Everything was a buffet. We ended up having Dominos Pizza delievered the last two nights because we could not handle the food any longer. There is no beach at this resort. It is all seaweed and rocks. You can rent paddle boats and kayaks, but are limited to a specific area. There is a kids club and our three children loved it, however, it was only available 3-4 hours per day, unlike the advertised hours. The weather was great and we did get a nice tan! Good Luck if this is your destiniation.
reviews.title: Terrible!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Myself and a few girlfriends decided to go on a nice getaway to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Paradisus. The resort was absolutely gorgeous. The buffet was gross so expect to spend some cash at the local eateries. The key is to make friends with the resort staff because their very helpful with giving directions for local restaurants and attractions. Rent a car because it is easy to get around and the price to rent cars are really cheap and are accessible from San Juan Airport. I highly recommend the following restaurants which are 10 minutes away from the resort: EL Dejao and Las Vegas (Yummy!)

reviews.text: We did NOT upgrade to Royal Service, but still managed to have no issue with service or attentiveness by the staff. Example: one night we locked ourselves on our patio. (Actually not that hard to do, so watch out, people!) I flagged down one of the MANY golf carts that drive around offering rides to guests to ask him what we could do about it. (I was in my jammies, as was my husband, and didn't really want to walk back up to the front desk.) The driver stopped the golf cart, even though he had a passenger on it, went to a courtesy phone, had them speak to me to verify I was who I said I was, and then used his master key to get me back in my room. All was taken care of within 5 minutes.
